keyPolicies.policyDescription: Focused on high skill, high tech jobs whilst protecting employment rights.
Ending the privatisation and bringing services into a secure, publicly-provided NHS.
Ensuring schools are properly funded and reducing class sizes.
Putting more police on the streets to ensure communities are safe.
Raising the minimum wage to a real living wage of at least £10 per hour.

issues.economy: A New Modern Industrial Strategy focused on high skill, high tech jobs whilst protecting employment rights.
issues.education: Education for All ensuring schools are properly funded and reducing class sizes.
issues.health: An NHS for the Many ending the privatisation and bringing services into a secure, publicly-provided NHS.
issues.socialWelfare: A Real Living Wage raising the minimum wage to a real living wage of at least £10 per hour.

images.caption: Mark McDonald, Labour's Parliamentary Candidate for Stoke-on-Trent South

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet requests constituents to indicate what they think is the most important issue locally but does not provide content from the candidate or campaign on this matter. The left side of the leaflet outlines the pledges but does not include additional narrative or personal statements.
